name: Test Stone
description:
The Genesis Stone is the world’s first carbonized NFT. 

It captures carbon from the atmosphere by consuming tokens representing carbon offsets that have been bridged on-chain, specifically Base Carbon Tonne tokens (BCT). 

We chose a rock for the first carbonized NFT in existence as a nod to the EtherRock, which became a flashpoint of criticism surrounding the value of NFTs. Were they simply jpegs? We believe carbonized NFTs offer a compelling argument in that debate.

The surface of The Genesis Stone was modeled to resemble basalt - a carbon-capturing rock that contains high concentrations of calcium and magnesium ions that react with CO2. The diamond-like shape of The Genesis Stone loosely imitates the Ethereum logo, as an acknowledgment of the technological innovation of the Ethereum blockchain. On the surface of The Genesis Stone is a trace of green moss, symbolizing the life-giving intent of carbonized NFTs.

Only 100 Genesis Stones will be available to mint.
